1_14DujeMmUQr14gCcg6ZUVcdU1DA5GphYvG.body: no, it's not a anon network. it's good place to host torrent site.

1_16EGCX1cmogYo2EPidRU3axQ6N3jNQndoa.body:
> [planespherev3](#comment_143_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): I don't have any competence in computer science, but i think if most people use VPNs, it should be very hard to censor ZeroNet. 
> ZeroNet could be blocked on the  ISP level, but not if users use VPNs (located in countries which do not block). And there are about 20000 different VPNs around the world.
> IMHO, the biggest force against censorship, isn't Tor, Zeronet, Freenet, but the combination of such networks with VPNs.

no. ZeroNet can not be take down on ISP. if they do that, they'll have to cut off all/most transnational connection. damage clearly outweigh benefit, nobody would do that.

> [alarus](#comment_1_1BpgM1PZJAkqa8cDzvfKMMSb7i9vTjQx82): Faster, but less secure - which is the point of the question.
but it wasn't designed to be secure. it's a practical alt-internet highly resistant to take down, compatible with tor.
